fields.description:
As a user of the Eucalyptus Management Console I would like to perform operations on multiple instances at once so that I don't need to use the CLI to perform those operations.

See https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Landing+page+header+info for possible multi-select actions

Suggested QA/regression checks:
1. The More Actions button/dropdown should be disabled unless at least one item is selected
2. Only the following items in the More Actions drop-down menu should be enabled when 2 or more items are selected: Stop, Start, Reboot, Terminate, Disassociate IP address.
3. The following actions redirect to other pages instead of opening a dialog: View details (goes to General tab), Manage volumes, View monitoring, Launch more like this, Create scaling group launch configuration, Create image

2. All menu items should be enabled when one item is selected except the following cases:
  - The "Stop" action should be disabled except for an EBS-backed instance in the "running" state
  - The "Start" action should be disabled except for an EBS-backed instance in the "stopped" state
  - The "Disassociate IP address" action should be disabled unless a running instance has an associated elastic IP address (elastic IPs have hyperlinks).
  - The following actions should be disabled for a stopped instance: Connect to instance, View console output, Associate/disassociate IP address, Stop, and Reboot

Known Issues:
- When at least one item is in a transitional state, the More Actions drop-down menu disappears automatically (Tracked in GUI-2446)

fields.summary: Implement multi-select checkboxes on Instances landing page

comments.body:
Ready for UX review on branch GUI-2320.

PR is at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1794

[~lnajjar]: Were you able to remove the single-instance actions from the More actions item list in the wireframe for the instances landing page header?

You're asking about:

* UX-96 Update Landing Page Header Info Landing Page Buttons to Support Multi-Select Tables ([https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/UX-96])
* Landing page header info wireframe ([https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Landing+page+header+info])

UX-96 is in the "Done" swim lane so it is approved and ready for coding.

To re-visit this topic and make a change, will you please ask [~jloza]?

[~jloza]: Could you approve the proposal to reduce the More actions list for the instances landing page from 14 items to 5?  The only actions that apply to multi-select are start/stop (for EBS-backed instances), reboot, terminate, and disassociate IP address.  Sorry I didn't catch that sooner.

Verified on Macintosh running Chrome Version 48.0.2564.103 (64-bit), Firefox 43.0.4, and Safari 9.0.3.

UX review passed. Ready for code review.

[~dkavanagh]: Hold off on reviewing PR 1794 -- I need to sort out the Jenkins issues and modify one of the tests to account for moving the "Terminate Instances" button to within the "More Actions" button

hi [~kgill], this should not have passed UX review, as it is not implemented as designed. 

Please implement the full set of actions for the instances more actions menu as indicated in the wireframe for https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Landing+page+header+info

This should not be limited to just batch actions, that was not the approved design.

[~jloza]: OK, I'm at a loss here why we're including the single-item actions in the "More actions" multi-select button.  [~lnajjar] and I strongly believe the single-item actions are adequately handled by the row item's actions menu, and including the single-item actions in the more actions drop-down would balloon the list from 5 items to 14 (yikes!).  There are also implementation challenges to incorporating the single-item actions in the more actions drop-down, as we will lose the ability to selectively disable drop-down menu items based on the selected items.

[~jloza]: I'll try to address the implementation challenges for incorporating the single-item actions in the more actions drop-down, as I was notified by [~lnajjar] during our sprint 4 planning meeting that a UX review meeting (which I unfortunately couldn't attend IIRC) already finalized the wireframe for the landing page headers.  

I still believe incorporating the single-item actions in the more actions drop-down needlessly clutters the interface and violates the "there should be one, and preferably only one, obvious way to accomplish a goal" approach advocated in The Zen of Python and by Barry Schwartz in his book _The Paradox of Choice_.  Including the single-item actions also significantly increases the QA test matrix surface and increases regression potential.  Another concern is the fact that the More Actions button isn't fixed when the user scrolls down the page, making it more difficult to perform a single-item action such as opening the "View console output" dialog for items below the fold.

That said, I'll defer to the approved wireframe if you strongly believe we should include the single-item actions in the More Actions menu.
remember, what is best practice in software development is not necessarily best practice in UX design.

[~dkavanagh]: I'm not just referring to software development -- note my reference to the Schwartz book.  Steve Krug's _Don't Make Me Think_ is another that advocates simplicity by reducing redundancy.

hi [~kgill], single items can always reach actions via the row actions menu, it shouldn't disappear as part of this implementation. However, fixing the more actions button (and other relevant items that share that row) might be nice as well. :)

I am sure you can fix the item disablement issue, I believe in you! We were able to do that in 3.x. Note that menu section dividers will also help the user parse the list, which I believe were included in the design?

Thanks,

J.

[~jloza], [~kgill], I had looked at dividers with foundation dropdowns as part of another ticket. The dividers aren't supported in that widget. I found CSS ways to add them to all items, so we may be able to add them selectively by tagging certain menu items with a class that applies a bottom border.
[~lnajjar]: I've incorporated the single-item actions for the instances landing page in GUI-2320.  Could you review and assign to [~dkavanagh] for code review after your UX review passes?

Hi, [~kgill]. Looks like we could use some clarification.

1. Are you writing about the "More Actions" button on the Instances landing page?
2. When you write "single-select," do you mean when one of the checkboxes is selected and the user clicks on "More Actions?"

I did a pull request on GUI-2320 and cleared my cache. When I selected a single checkbox on the Instances landing page, I got a shorter list than the one shown in the Landing Page Info Header wireframe for when one instance is selected.
 !Single-select More Actions on Instances landing page.png|thumbnail!  !Instances single-select on Landing Page Header Info wireframe.png|thumbnail! 

Any idea what is going on?

A related issue... While a new instance was "pending," I selected the other instance, the "More Actions." The "More Actions" menu displayed for a second or two, then closed. Weird. After the instance status changed to "running," the menu stayed open.

[~lnajjar]: You'll probably need to pull the latest changes to your GUI-2320 branch to see the expanded list of 14 items.

For the More Actions menu disappearing when items are in a transitional state, I'll open a separate ticket to address that since I haven't been able to figure out how to prevent the menu from disappearing without removing the auto-refresh capability when items are in transition.

After screen share session with [~kgill], we figured out that launcher.sh failed to restart the console when the latest changes for the GUI-2320 branch were pulled. 

When we manually restarted, I got the latest code. Will proceed with UX review.

Thanks, [~kgill].

[~kgill], it looks like the order of the actions in the coded version does not quite match the order in the wireframed version (see attachments). Look at the following "More Actions" actions:

* Create scaling group launch configuration
* Create image

Would you to change the order to match the wireframe or do you believe your (slightly revised) order is better for our users?
[~lnajjar]: Good catch, fixed order in latest commit (https://git.io/v2JRF)

Verified using Macintosh running Chrome Version 48.0.2564.109 (64-bit), Firefox 44.0.1, and Safari 9.0.3.

UX review passed.
